explains: adj. （飞机、火箭等）远程的；长期的；远大的
wordGroup: long-range missile 远程导弹；洲际弹道导弹

sentences.en: He is eager to reach agreement with the U.S. on reducing long-range nuclear missiles.
sentences.cn: 他渴望与美国就减少远程核导弹达成协议。

sentences.en: It was first developed for the US government as a long-range spy aircraft, but was abandoned following budget cutbacks.
sentences.cn: 它最初是为美国政府研制的远程间谍飞机，但由于预算削减而被放弃研制。

sentences.en: Too many people in this country, including some among our elected leadership, still do not understand how science works or why robust, long-range investments in research vitally matter.
sentences.cn: 在这个国家有太多的人，包括我们选举出来的其中一部分领导层，仍然不明白科学是如何运作的，也不明白为什么稳健、长期的投资对研究是至关重要的。
